name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

key_work.title: Georges Méliès in Un homme de têtes (The Four Troublesome Heads)
key_work.brief_description: Georges Méliès was truly a magician of the screen. It’s no surprise, considering he enchanted people as an illusionist before devising many special effects and film techniques. At the turn of the 21st century he created seamless screen illusions through in-camera tricks.

constellations_primary.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_primary.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

start.title: Orphan Black
start.creator_credit: MacKenzie Donaldson, Claire Welland and Tatiana Maslany
start.brief_description: Orphan Black follows an outsider and orphan whose life changes dramatically after witnessing the suicide of a woman who looks just like her. Sarah assumes her identity, her boyfriend and her bank account.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

end.title: Manifesto
end.creator_credit: Julian Rosefeldt, Bayerischer Rundfunk and Schiwago Film
end.brief_description: Julian Rosefeldt’s outstanding tribute to various art manifestos of the 19th and 20th century, ranging from Communism to Dogme, in connection with 13 different characters played by Cate Blanchett. A striking humorous audio-visual experience.

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and cyberpunk are often powerful projections of the future, which may act as dystopic warnings or strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above adversity.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

links.description: Both Orphan Black and Manifesto showcase the transformative ability of their stars, with Cate Blanchett and Tatiana Maslany each playing over a dozen characters in their respective works.

start.title: The Play House
start.creator_credit: Edward F. Cline, Joseph M. Schenck and Buster Keaton
start.brief_description: The Play House is a 1921 American two-reel silent comedy film written, directed by, and starring Buster Keaton. The movie runs for 22 minutes, and is most famous for an opening sequence in which Keaton plays every role.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

end.title: The Matrix
end.creator_credit: Joel Silver and Village Roadshow Pictures
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1999

video_links.name: The Matrix - 20th Anniversary - Warner Bros. UK

end.brief_description: Set in the 22nd century, The Matrix tells the story of a computer hacker who joins a group of underground insurgents fighting the vast and powerful computers who now rule the earth.

constellations_other.name: Directions of storytelling
constellations_other.description: Panoramic slides gave magic lanternists the ability to progress narratives by adjusting slides left or right. This movement is emblematic of a panning shot where the camera follows the action the natural way your head moves.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

links.description: By 1999, digital wizardy had advanced to the point that The Matrix could CGI hundreds of Hugo Weavings’ Agent Smith into one scene.

start.title: Georges Méliès in Un homme de têtes (The Four Troublesome Heads)
start.brief_description: Georges Méliès was truly a magician of the screen. It’s no surprise, considering he enchanted people as an illusionist before devising many special effects and film techniques. At the turn of the 21st century he created seamless screen illusions through in-camera tricks.

end.title: The Play House
end.creator_credit: Edward F. Cline, Joseph M. Schenck and Buster Keaton
end.brief_description: The Play House is a 1921 American two-reel silent comedy film written, directed by, and starring Buster Keaton. The movie runs for 22 minutes, and is most famous for an opening sequence in which Keaton plays every role.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

links.description: Pioneering filmmaker Georges Méliès used multiple exposures to create the special effect of multiple, floating heads. Likewise, American filmmaker Buster Keaton used camera tricks and techniques to multiply himself in The Playhouse.

start.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1999

video_links.name: The Matrix - 20th Anniversary - Warner Bros. UK

start.brief_description: Set in the 22nd century, The Matrix tells the story of a computer hacker who joins a group of underground insurgents fighting the vast and powerful computers who now rule the earth.

constellations_other.description: Panoramic slides gave magic lanternists the ability to progress narratives by adjusting slides left or right. This movement is emblematic of a panning shot where the camera follows the action the natural way your head moves.

end.title: Twin Dragons
end.brief_description: Twins, separated at birth, end up as a Hong Kong gangster and a New York concert pianist. When the pianist travels to Hong Kong for a concert, the two inevitably get mistaken for each other.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

links.description: The Matrix borrows heavily from Hong Kong martial arts films like Twin Dragons, where special effects let Jackie Chan play identical twins.

start.title: Twin Dragons
start.brief_description: Twins, separated at birth, end up as a Hong Kong gangster and a New York concert pianist. When the pianist travels to Hong Kong for a concert, the two inevitably get mistaken for each other.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

end.title: Orphan Black
end.creator_credit: MacKenzie Donaldson, Claire Welland and Tatiana Maslany
end.brief_description: Orphan Black follows an outsider and orphan whose life changes dramatically after witnessing the suicide of a woman who looks just like her. Sarah assumes her identity, her boyfriend and her bank account.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

links.description: As visual effects got easier and cheaper, stories could explore doubling characters. Orphan Black, a sci-fi show about cloning, features multiple versions of the same actress, Tatiana Maslany, on screen.
